briefTitle: Trial of Trimosan Gel Effect on Pessary-associated Bacterial Vaginosis

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Female
* Indications for initiation of pessary use and planning to be fitted for and wear a pessary

Exclusion Criteria:

* Male
* Already using a pessary or have used in the last year
* History of recurrent or chronic bacterial vaginosis with \> 2 episodes per year or symptoms reported for \> 6 months out of last year
* Active known vaginal infection (symptomatic and/or untreated) or completion of treatment for BV or cervical/vaginal infection within one week of recruitment
* History of active vaginal ulcerative disease (active ulcers from atrophy, herpes symptoms at recruitment, or HSV with \> 2 outbreaks per year or last outbreak \< 1 month ago)
* Chronic antibiotic use for indications not listed above

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Patients With Bacterial Vaginosis at 3 Months
outcomeMeasures.description: The primary outcome is the rate of bacterial vaginosis after pessary fitting as measured by OSOM BV blue (Genzyme) and gram stain, measured in women using and women not using Trimo-San gel after pessary fitting, at 3 months, with the denominator being the number of women having a gram stain at the 3 months time point in each group

outcomeMeasures.title: Participants With Any Bothersome Vaginal Symptom at 3 Months
outcomeMeasures.description: Vaginal symptoms and effect of vaginal symptoms on pessary wearers measured before and after pessary fitting by questionnaire based on verified vaginal symptoms questionnaire at 3 months, with the denominator being the number of women completing the questionnaire at the 3 months time point in each group

commonTop: Any vaginal symptom attributable possibly to pessary
